noun.description: An obsessive interest in or feeling about someone or something.
examples: our fixation with diet and fitness
his fixation on the details of other people's erotic lives

noun.description: The action of making something firm or stable.
The action of concentrating the eyes directly on something.
examples: during the period of total blindness there was a complete absence of visual fixation

origin: Late Middle English (originally as an alchemical term denoting the process of reducing a volatile spirit or essence to a permanent bodily form): from medieval Latin fixatio(n-), from fixare (see fix).
